input_text:
Job Title: Machine Operator PR05 (Revo) - 1st Shift - Waterloo KPR

Location: Waterloo, IA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Details:

Tyson Foods was named as One of America’s Most JUST Companies for a 5th year! This is a reflection of the work we do to support our team members and the customers, consumers, and the communities we serve.

We invest in our team members and their success by providing resources like BENEFITS ON DAY ONE OF EMPLOYMENT and FREE EDUCATION! 

Benefits include: medical/Rx, dental, and vision coverage; 9 paid holidays; 1 week of paid vacation after 6 months, plus earned time off; 401(k) with employer match; stock purchase program; and product purchase program. We also offer CAREER GROWTH and much more!

Whether you are seeking a job for right now or a career for forever – Tyson has what you are looking for!  Tyson has a committed track record of promoting from within because we believe our Team Members can grow into the best leaders.

If you are looking to make an impact in a meaningful way, join us at Tyson Foods where we are raising the world’s expectations for how much good food can do!  We create quality products in a safe work environment. Waterloo KPR produces fully cooked, ready-to-eat products. 

This job posting is for 1st shift with a general work schedule of Monday through Friday, and Saturdays as scheduled. Work hours are generally 5:00 a.m. to 1:00/2:00 p.m. The base rate of pay is $21.90/hour. This job is eligible for overtime pay.  Team members must be willing to work overtime and weekends, as needed.

To be considered for employment, you must provide your social security number at the end of the application under National ID# (after seeing “Congratulations”).

Job Responsibilities:

Safely and efficiently operates the V-pump and revo formers, assembles/disassembles as needed Keeps area and equipment clean Measures and makes adjustments needed to maintain patty specifications Measures patties to ensure compliance with specifications Documentation - keeps thorough and accurate records of production data All team members are responsible for safety, including but not limited to, personal safety and food safety Complies with all company and USDA policies/guidelines and reports known or suspected violations Attends monthly and annual required training (e.g., Safety, HACCP, HR topics, LOTO, PIT) Performs other duties, as assigned 

Job Requirements:

At least three (3) months of relevant operator experience with one or a combination of employers At least four (4) months of continuous employment with one employer in the past two (2) years High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) preferred, but not required Basic computer skills to navigate systems and perform data entry Experience with inventory control methods preferred Ability to record information using company-provided forms and procedures Ability to understand and ensure compliance with equipment and product specifications Ability to accurately perform math functions: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division Ability to report to work as scheduled and work scheduled hours to meet job expectations, have flexibility to work other jobs, as needed, and work weekends and overtime, as needed Ability to work professionally and respectfully with others while demonstrating positive interpersonal skills, and communicates effectively with all team members and management Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and thoroughness Ability to identify, act with a sense of urgency, and resolve problems/inconsistencies, getting help from management or others, as needed Requires standing, walking, bending, stooping, twisting, stretching, climbing, pushing, pulling, and reaching above, below, and at shoulder level Ability to lift, carry, push, and pull up to 60 lbs. below waist, at waist level, and above shoulder level Ability to work while standing or walking on hard floors for a period of up to 8-10 hours/day Ability to climb up and down stairs/ladders to get to/from work areas and to work at elevated levels and various heights and in confined spaces, as needed Ability to work in an environment where extreme temperatures range seasonally from hot/warm to cold/freezing, where conditions may be damp and/or wet, and concrete floors may be slippery in some areas Ability to perform repetitive motions, flex/grip with wrists/hands, and use tools (e.g., box knife, metal scraper) Ability to wear personal protective equipment (PPE), including hard hat, safety glasses, ear protection (plugs or muffs), hair net / beard guard, steel-toed boots, and gloves 

Relocation Assistance Eligible:

No

Work Shift: 

A Shift (United States of America)

Hourly Applicants ONLY -You must complete the task after submitting your application to provide additional information to be considered for employment.

Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We provide our team members and their families with paid time off; 401(k) plans; affordable health, life, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits; and more.

CCPA Notice. If you are a California resident, and would like to learn more about what categories of personal information we collect when you apply for this job, and how we may use that information, please read our CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection, click here.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Machine Operator PR05 (Revo) - 1st Shift - Waterloo KPR
output_json.summary: Full-time position at Tyson Foods in Waterloo, IA, offering benefits on day one of employment and free education.
job_responsibilities: Operates V-pump and Revo formers safely and efficiently
Ensures safety and compliance with company and USDA policies
physical_requirements: Standing, walking, bending, stooping, twisting, stretching, climbing, pushing, pulling, reaching
Lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 60 lbs.
Working on hard floors for up to 8-10 hours/day
output_json.company_information: Tyson Foods offers a range of benefits including medical/Rx, dental, and vision coverage, paid holidays, vacation after 6 months, earned time off, 401(k) with employer match, stock purchase program, product purchase program, and career growth opportunities.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, considering all qualified applicants without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

other.content: Applicants must provide their social security number at the end of the application under National ID#. Relocation assistance is not eligible. Work shift is A Shift (United States of America). Hourly applicants must complete additional information after submitting their application.
For California residents, please review the CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection.
